resources.string:
Cards must be entered in Value–Suit format. Values and suits are abbreviated to a single letter or number (see below)
1–9 – One – Nine
0 – Ten
J – Jack
Q – Queen
K – King
C – Clubs
S – Spades
D – Diamonds
H – Hearts
Ex: If your starting hand is Ace of Clubs and Ten of Hearts, you would enter AC0H
- Press to see the order of scoring hands in poker.
- In this section, you can give your starting hand, and My Poker Assistant will tell you what rankn your starting hand is and give you your odds of winning.
- In this section, you can give My Poker Assistant your starting hand as well as cards currently revealed on the table, and it will tell you your winning odds.
10 of Clubs, Jack of Clubs, Queen of Clubs, King of Clubs, Ace of Clubs
5 of Diamonds, 6 of Diamonds, 7 of Diamonds, 8 of Diamonds, 9 of Diamonds
8 of Clubs, 8 of Diamonds, 8 of Hearts, 8 of Spades, 4 of Spades
6 of Spades, 6 of Hearts, 6 of Diamonds, 3 of Clubs, 3 of Diamonds
5 of Clubs, 8 of Clubs, 10 of Clubs, Queen of Clubs, King of Clubs
10 of Clubs, Jack of Diamonds, Queen of Spades, King of Hearts, Ace of Spades
6 of Spades, 6 of Hearts, 6 of Diamonds, 3 of Clubs, 5 of Clubs
7 of Hearts, 7 of Spades, 9 of Diamonds, 9 of Clubs, 4 of Spades
Ace of Spades, Ace of Hearts, 6 of Spades, 4 of Diamonds, 2 of Hearts
King of Clubs, 8 of Spades, 6 of Diamonds, 5 of Diamonds, 3 of Clubs

The odds your hand beats another random hand\nNote: This is not a practical statistic to use when determining whether or not to play your hand. Instead, it should be used to inform you of the general strength of your hand given a flop/turn/river.

Cards must be entered in Value–Suit format. Values and suits are abbreviated to a single letter or number (see below)
1–9 – One – Nine
0 – Ten
J – Jack
Q – Queen
K – King
C – Clubs
S – Spades
D – Diamonds
H – Hearts
Ex: If your starting hand is Ace of Clubs and Ten of Hearts, you would enter AC0H

Note: You must enter at least three table cards. The more cards you enter, the faster My Poker Assistant is able to calculate your winning odds.
The hand\'s rank out of the 169 possible starting hands
How often this hand wins when paired against nine other random hands.
